content:
Since Ewout isn't running for reelection for FHIR-I co-chair, I'm interested in serving in that position. I have a lot of experience chairing meetings
- Vice-chair of the Alcohol License Review Committee of the City of Madison, WI
- President of the Bartell Community Theatre Foundation
- former President of two other non-profit organization's boards of directors
I've worked on implementations of HL7 and IHE standards for more than fifteen years, including FHIR for the last five.
Please consider writing me in for the open seat.

Hello everyone:
Since Ewout Kramer decided not to run re-election, I would like to put my name into the hat of write-in candidates.
Here is my brief resume:Â  I have participated FHIR-I WG meeting since 2013. I have learned a lot of FHIR during the last six years. My FHIR-I involvement helped me to be the first to pass FHIR Proficiency Certification. Other than FHIR-I WG, I also outreached to CDS, Pharmacy, and Vocabulary Work Groups. Outside HL7 community, I have worked at both private sector and public sector. As a co-chair, I will continue current work group's agenda, and serving FHIR activities in other work groups. Thank you for voting for me.
